page.title: 12 DUDSBURY CAMP_HISTORY.
page.content: This site has been in regular use by people for centuries.Originally it was the site of an iron age hill fort.Good use was made of the natural defences provided by the area and large dykes were also built.Parts of these are still visible. Remains from this original settlement have been found and are now in various local museums.It is claimed that the site was an important port in early times_second in importance only to the port at Hengistbury Head.As this was an international port of some consequence perhaps Dudsbury was busy. The Romans perhaps used the site. It reverted to use as pasture land for many years belonging to the Wimborne estate until 1931 when it passed into the hands of the Dorset Girl Guide Association.
